responses: He was born on the 12th of July 100 BC and lived for 55 years.

The assassination of Julius Caesar was a conspiracy of several Roman senators, notably led by Marcus Junius Brutus. 
They stabbed Caesar to death in the Theatre of Pompey on the Ides of March (15 March) 44 BC.

Gaius Julius Caesar was a populist Roman dictator, politician, and military general who played a critical role in the events that led to the demise of the Roman Republic and the rise of the Roman Empire.
Caesar had three legitimate wives: Cornelia, Pompeia, and Calpurnia. He also had multiple affairs most notably with Cleopatra.
Gaius Octavius, also known as Augustus, succeeded Caeasar. He was dictator from 27 BC - 14 AD (41 years).

responses: He had two sons and one daughter: Augustus (adopted), Caesarion, and Julia Caesaris.

responses: He held political offices from 59 BC - 44 BC (15 years), but was dictator from 49 BC- 44 BC (5 years).
